    Publications

    You can also find my articles on my Google Scholar profile.

    Journal Articles

    Angular momentum transfer from swift electrons to non-spherical nanoparticles within the dipolar approximation

    Published in Ultramicroscopy, 2024

    We study angular momentum transfer from a swift electron to non-spherical metallic nanoparticles within a dipolar approximation, focusing on spheroidal and polyhedral (Platonic solid) geometries and implications for nanomanipulation and EELS.

    Download Paper

    Conference Papers

    Implementation for Efficient Numerical Computation of Electron Beam Momentum Transfer Driven by Optical Excitations in Large Spherical Nanoparticles

    Published in Frontiers in Optics + Laser Science (OPTICA), 2025

    Conference proceedings presenting efficient numerical strategies for computing electron-beam momentum transfer induced by optically excited resonances, with applications to large nanoparticles and advanced electron microscopy simulations.

    Download Paper

    Momentum transfer driven by optical excitations in large spherical nanoparticles

    Published in Oxford University Press US, 2025

    Proceedings contribution investigating momentum transfer from swift electrons to large spherical nanoparticles mediated by optically driven resonances, emphasizing numerical implementation and scaling behavior relevant for electron microscopy.

    Download Paper

    Exploring momentum transfer in electron microscopy: Size and material effects on nanoparticle resonances

    Published in Oxford University Press US, 2024

    Proceedings contribution examining how nanoparticle size and material parameters shape electron-driven momentum-transfer resonances relevant for electron microscopy and nanoplasmonics.

    Download Paper

    Angular momentum transfer from swift electrons to small spheroidal nanoparticles in the dipole approximation

    Published in Oxford University Press US, 2023

    Proceedings contribution presenting a dipole-approximation treatment of angular momentum transfer from swift electrons to small spheroidal nanoparticles, emphasizing geometry dependence and resonance behavior.

    Download Paper
